summary.Title: Professor in Health Informatics and Technology
summary.JobHeadline: Professor in Health Informatics and Technology
summary.Presentation:
The Maersk Mc-Kinney Moller Institute, University of Southern Denmark (SDU) in Odense, invites applications for a position as professor in Health Informatics and Technology. 
SDU Health Info
summary.OccupationGroup: Forskning og universitetsundervisning, naturvidenskab og teknik

JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Professor in Health Informatics and Technology
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The Maersk Mc-Kinney Moller Institute, University of Southern Denmark (SDU) in Odense, invites applications for a position as professor in Health Informatics and Technology. 

SDU Health Informatics and Technology (SDU HIT) strives to develop novel and ready to deploy technical solutions in a transdisciplinary manner. SDU HIT has a large portfolio of transdisciplinary projects involving numerous partners from healthcare, academia, industry and network organizations.

The Maersk Mc-Kinney Moller Institute is an internationally recognized research department with strong research units in robotics, drones, artificial intelligence, software engineering, energy informatics, and health informatics and technology. 

Denmark is known to be a great place to live and work. There is a high quality of life in and around Odense, and at SDU we value a well-functioning work-life balance. More information about the benefits may be found here.

Job description and expected profile

Candidates for this position must have a solid research background within (at least one, preferably several, of) the following fields:

  • Biomedical electrical instrumentation circuits
  • Bioelectromagnetism
  • Bioimpedance analysis
  • Wearable sensor devices
  • Unobtrusive acquisition of physiological signals
  • Camera based vital sign monitoring
  • Signal processing and machine learning methods for biomedical sensors pain

Experience in the following application areas will be considered benefits:

  • Neurocritical monitoring
  • Driver state estimation
  • Tissue analysis

Candidates must hold a PhD (or equivalent) in electrical or biomedical engineering, or a closely related field.

In the assessment of candidates, emphasis and consideration will be given to:

  • Research demonstrated by publications in relevant scientific journals and conferences
  • Experience in interdisciplinary research collaboration
  • Experience with medical studies
  • A relevant international network for research and collaboration activities, research experience abroad
  • Experience in attracting funding for research projects, and demonstrated experience in research leadership, also in projects with multiple partners (e.g. EU projects)

The successful candidate is expected to develop and engage in a vigorous research program, and actively participate in attracting external research funding in close collaboration with colleagues and management.

The successful applicant will be expected to provide outstanding education, supervise bachelor, master and PhD level students.

Contact information

Further information is available from Head of Department, Kasper Hallenborg: +45 2135 6256 or hallenborg@mmmi.sdu.dk.

If you experience technical problems you must contact support-sdujob@sdu.dk.

Conditions of employment
The candidate should have a PhD degree within the mentioned research area.

The successful applicant will be employed in accordance with the agreement between the Ministry of Finance and the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. Please check links for more information on salary and taxation.

The starting date for the position is as soon as possible in 2022, and it will be agreed with the successful candidate.

The assessment process
Read about the Assessment and selection process. Shortlisting may be used. 

Application procedure

The faculty expects applicants to read How to apply before applying. 

The application must be in English and must include:

  • Cover letter including statement of motivation
  • Curriculum Vitae 
  • Certificates/Diplomas (MSc and PhD) 
  • Research Statement, max. 3 pages
  • Information on previous teaching and supervision experience. Please attach as Teaching Portfolio
  • Complete list of publications 
  • 8-12 most relevant publications for the position
  • Documentation of leadership experience, reference letters and other relevant qualifications may also be included.

The application deadline is 31.05.2022.

The University wishes our staff to reflect the diversity of society and thus welcomes applications from all qualified candidates regardless of personal background.

Further information for international applicants about entering and working in Denmark.

Further information about The Faculty of Engineering.
